results.title: Footscray 1911
results.brief_description: Scenes of Footscray around 1911. Shows street scenes, transport, recreation and clothing. Recognizable scenes include Nicholson Street and Forges Store. Footscray Railway Station and Federal Hall.

results.title: Glimpses of Australia. [No. 02?]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items include: 1. A lesson in geography - shows the size of Australia in relation to Scandinavia and Europe. 2. Warburton District - located on the Great Dividing Range, Victoria, shows scenery and inhabitants. 3. The Princes Highway - from Lakes Entrance to Narooma inlet. Shows Lakes Entrance locals and holiday-makers; an Australian First Nations person fishing with a spear; Narooma’s beautiful inlet; oyster fishing and eating. 4. Animal bandits - animals dance to the sound of birds; they form a band but their tunes are unbearable until they attend Professor Heron’s school of music.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 05]
results.brief_description: A compilation of silent newsreels including: 1. Coronation of (probably) King George V. 2. The tribute of the forest - The ‘Hoop Pine’ of Queensland used for making matches and butter boxes. An example of the “winch and steel cable” method (?) - logging in Queensland. Bullock teams also shown hauling logs. 3. Burton Holmes’ Film Reels of Travel - alpine vistas. 4. Alfred Weiss presents ‘Another kick coming’. 5. Sheep dipping and general farm scenes. 6. Granite Quarry in action. 7. Steel production.

results.title: Victoria's welcome to press delegates
results.brief_description: Viscount Burnham is welcomed by S.S. Argyle, M.L.A. Chief Secretary of Victoria. Items of interest are pointed out, indicating Victoria’s development as a state including footage of Sir John Monash, development of the Hume Weir, Yallourn Open Cut mine, the Dandenong Ranges/Ferntree Gully, Yarra Glen, Camperdown, Rochester, the “Better Farming Train”, Bendigo, Geelong and Geelong Grammar, and Ballarat. Source: National Film and Sound Archive.

results.title: [Melbourne newsreel: 1925]
results.brief_description: A newsreel of Melbourne in 1925 containing scenes of Empire Day celebrations at Princes Hill State School, Carlton; the opening of the Melbourne Track Season; a three-mile handicap race at Caulfield Racecourse by the Combined Harriers; and long-distance running. Re-released in 1947 by the National Film Archive.

results.title: [Lasker and Lasker Surf Outfitters: bathing suits and caps: advertisement]
results.brief_description: Promotes Lasker and Lasker Surf Outfitters of 402 and 404 George St, Sydney, N.S.W. Women and men model bathing suits and caps on a beach. Shots include the models standing next to a surf boat, models with parasols, and a model putting on a beach coat. (Cinema advertisement, includes intertitles).

results.title: [St Kilda Esplanade]
results.brief_description: Early footage of St Kilda, Victoria, showing the entrance to Luna Park with a group of people walking past and chatting outside the Daylight Picture Cinema next door. Ends with a group of people standing on a small jetty on the beach.

results.title: Australian gazette. No. 3
results.brief_description: This reel consists of 7 magazine items, including snapshots of the Fitzroy Gardens, a trip to Seal Rock by boat, Kangaroos at Wilson’s Prom, beehives shot in close-up and some prize footage of a motorcycle race on a track around the outside of the Exhibition Buildings. There is also some surprising early experimental filming of Flinders Street, and traffic and crowds on Swanston Street. One amazing shot appears upside-down and then mid-way proceeds to turn upright and show the traffic and people travelling backwards. Footage is then sped up for a cable car ride down a main street. No credits available.

results.title: [William Darbyshire Home Movies: Reel 12]
results.brief_description:
William (Billy) Darbyshire (1903–1979) was a film enthusiast and traveller who emigrated with his parents from England to Australia in 1911. It may have been this early trip that influenced a young Billy to travel the world later in life and film his travels as he went.

First travelling to Africa for work and to various destinations whilst in service during WWII, Billy would continue to travel after the war throughout Asia, Europe, Africa, the Pacific and North America. It was in this period, during the 1960s, that he purchased an 8mm movie camera which resulted in a collection of films that capture his travels, taking in the sites of the world from Asia to Europe and Africa to the Americas.

The films were originally made using Standard 8mm film. The quality of the film can be a little challenging as it is jumpy, damaged and scratched at times.

This film contains scenes of Billy’s travels on the steamship Southern Cross, in 1960 which travelled between Australia and Europe. It is a little difficult to locate exactly where Billy visits but we can definitely see scenes of England, the Netherlands and Greece. The SS Southern Cross was a modern passenger ship built in 1955 to an innovative design which catered specifically for the tourist trade, starting a trend of ‘aft-engined’ ships, leaving more space for passengers and their needs. The Southern Cross was also the first major liner to have no cargo space, other than for ship’s stores and passenger luggage.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:03:00 views of a shoreline and sea
00:01:14:00 a large ship or ferry being loaded at the dock
00:01:48:00 a large and busy tugboat
00:01:50:00 passengers playing tennis on the deck of a ship
00:02:30:00 South Africa Airways airplane on the tarmac
00:03:15:00 a large fountain in a town setting
00:03:49:00 mountain views followed by a picturesque river flowing through hills
00:04:23:00 passengers travelling from a ship, in what appears to be a large lifeboat, to shore
00:04:51:00 views of a large military memorial in a public square setting.
00:04:58:00 dancers in traditional costume give an exhibition of Greek folk dancing to passengers on board a ship.
00:06:19:00 town houses and buildings overlooking houseboats moored on the banks of a canal, with a sign for Grachten (canal)
00:06:58:00 tramcar in a town
00:07:14:00 a large and crowded beach
00:07:36:00 street scenes
00:08:15:00 keen swimmers in a canal or river
00:08:24:00 a glimpse of a windmill
00:08:50:00 boats, ferries and yachts in a bay
00:09:30:00 a passenger ship arrives at a dock
00:10:54:00 scenes of lovely hills and farmlands, thatched cottages and beaches
00:12:15:00 a ‘Punch and Judy’ tent indicates that Billy is in England
00:14:50:00 a plane is filmed overhead
00:15:15:00 a Greek ‘Evezone’ presidential guard dressed in traditional costume
00:16:16:00 a spectacular view of mountain seen at the end of a street, behind shops and buildings, probably in Greece

group.title: [William Darbyshire Home Movie Collection]
group.material_description: 13 x 200ft spools of 8mm home movie footage, plus 1 x DVD transfer of an additional spool (14 separate films in total).

results.title: [William Darbyshire Home Movies: Reel 10]
results.brief_description:
William (Billy) Darbyshire (1903–1979) was a film enthusiast and traveller who emigrated with his parents from England to Australia in 1911. It may have been this early trip that influenced a young Billy to travel the world later in life and film his travels as he went.

First travelling to Africa for work and to various destinations whilst in service during WWII, Billy would continue to travel after the war throughout Asia, Europe, Africa, the Pacific and North America. It was in this period, during the 1960s, that he purchased an 8mm movie camera which resulted in a collection of films that capture his travels, taking in the sites of the world from Asia to Europe and Africa to the Americas.

The films were originally made using Standard 8mm film. The quality of the film can be a little challenging as it is jumpy, damaged and scratched at times.

In this film, Billy travels to Rhodesia (Zimbabwe) and South Africa.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:14:00 several large passenger and cargo ships at alongside a dock, with mountains in the background.
00:01:20:00 a large ship wrecked and sitting on a reef or rocks off the shore.
00:02:30:00 scenes of mountains.
00:03:00:00 views of city gardens.
